name: cloudsearch_debug_datasources_items_checkAccess
description: Checks whether an item is accessible by specified principal. Principal must be a user; groups and domain values aren't supported. **Note:** This API requires an admin account to execute.

debugOptions.enableDebugging.description: If you are asked by Google to help with debugging, set this field. Otherwise, ignore this field.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

Principal.description: Reference to a user, group, or domain.

groupResourceName.description: This principal is a group identified using an external identity. The name field must specify the group resource name with this format: identitysources/{source_id}/groups/{ID}

userResourceName.description: This principal is a user identified using an external identity. The name field must specify the user resource name with this format: identitysources/{source_id}/users/{ID}

gsuiteDomain.description: This principal represents all users of the Google Workspace domain of the customer.

gsuiteGroupEmail.description: This principal references a Google Workspace group name.

gsuiteUserEmail.description: This principal references a Google Workspace user account.

$ul: **hasAccess**: Returns true if principal has access. Returns false otherwise.
